content.description: Start sitting down at a clear starting point and make your way up the rock however you want. Watch out for wolf spiders. Also pretty sharp rock and bad landing area.
content.location: After you take a left at the second split in the trail go past Broken Skin and follow the trail to the right. Keep going in between the two outcrops until the trail spits you out on the yellow trail. Go right on the yellow trail and keep following it up the hill until you see an outcrop on the left. It is the largest rock in the exposure you see right before the trail goes up the mountain. From there you can make your way up to the upper boulders.

content.description: Massive slab to the right of Broken Skin. Good for warming up.
content.location: Right off the unmarked trail that splits off to the left of the second intersection you come across.

content.description: Start on the slightly overhanging side of the larger boulder and make your way up using some small holds and the arete. Huge ledge on right off, using it is more like V1.
content.location: After you take a left at the split in the trail you will see Broken Skin. Keep following the trail past it. Go over the two fallen trees and you will see an outcropping where the trail turns right. Go over the furthest outcropping and you will see two pretty large erratic boulders.

content.description: Start to the left of the cave of Broken Skin and make your way up. Very sharp rock, you may cut your hands if you fall.

I have not been able to complete this project so the grade is unknown but if I had to take a shot in the dark I'd say it is V4-6. Start inside the cave from a sit start and make your way up. You need to slap your hand onto the sloping lip of the rock and it is VERY sharp in some places.
content.location: The first rock you see once you take a left on the unmarked trail. About 200-300 feet inÂ you will see a small cave.

content.description: This area features some outcroppings and a couple erratics.
